attributes.action: Ban ride sharing scheme known as 'pooling' for passenger's and driver's safety.
attributes.background: To improve safety of passengers vehicle sharing schemes like 'pooling' should be banned as you never know who will be next person sharing vehicle with you. Would you like to share a vehicle with a stranger? Female going home with stanger? Help London being safer place.
attributes.additional_details:
Pool ride has been advertised as cheaper option of Regular ride but litte do passengers know that means longer journey while driver is stopping to wait for next rider that requested pool ride. If driver does not stop is facing possible deactivation from platform and if does is facing low rating by riders which is leading also to deactivation from platform.
Both ways, driver is facing issues and rider safety is compromised.

attributes.action: For it to be standard, regular, practice to measure babies' heads.
attributes.background: Poppy's story! On August 25th Poppy's parents received the devastating news that she had water on the brain along with tumours. If Poppy's head had been measured they would have known it was the size of a 2 year old, having JUST turned one!
attributes.additional_details: Poppy's head was 6cm too big and had never been measured/recorded in her red book. Poppy is currently, with her parents, in HDU in Manchester Children's Hospital awaiting her fourth brain operation!

attributes.action: Introduce emergency legislation to keep the London Stock Exchange British
attributes.background: The London Stock Exchange is vital to British national interests, but is vulnerable to effective take-over by foreign interests, It must be protected and placed on a list of strategically important companies that can not be sold.

attributes.action: Strengthen laws to prosecute individuals who make false allegations of abuse
attributes.background: This petition calls for a Parliamentary debate to review whether current laws relating to the offences of perjury and perverting the course of justice are fit for purpose and that they are being pursued with vigour the the Crown Prosecution Service in cases of false allegations of abuse.
attributes.additional_details: False allegations of sexual and other types of abuse have a catastrophic effect upon the lives of those who are accused. Furthermore, making such allegations, whether motivated by a desire for vengeance, attention or compensation, also casts doubt on genuine complaints of abuse and undermines public confidence in our justice system. A review mechanism whereby compensation awarded to false accusers (where convictions are later quashed by the Court of Appeal or the Supreme Court) should exist.

attributes.action: Make Strangles a Notifiable Disease
attributes.background: Strangles is a deadly and horrific disease in horses. Bacteria is spread through direct and indirect contact. It causes horses great distress and pain and is difficult to deal with. Outbreaks are currently managed by the common sense of horse owners but often still result in spread of the disease.
attributes.additional_details: It often happens that outbreaks are kept secret and advised biosecurity is not adhered to correctly. Horse Welfare is the biggest concern as containment procedures are optional, meaning that it often spreads and more horses suffer. The damage to the equine industry is great; entire show seasons lost, loss of livestock, and loss of income. Were it a notifiable disease anyone who had a case would not be able to keep it secret and they would have to put correct biosecurity measures in place by law.

attributes.action: Urge India to stop killing Kashmiris& resolve it by holding impartial plebiscite
attributes.background: More than 68,000 people have been killed in the uprising and the subsequent Indian military crackdown in Indian administered Kashmir. In the current wave of unrest since 08/07/16 more then 20 protestors have died and more then 200 injured by the crakdown of Indian forces including army and police.
attributes.additional_details: The dispute of Kashmir started after the departure of British rule from the region and leaving the state of Kashmir to decide its fate. The Maharaja of Kashmir decided to merge with India against people's wishes. People's demand is a plebiscite to decide their own fate, which India has been denying. There is over 200,000 thousand Indian armed forces besides police and other security personnel to keep a tight control on the region by might. More than 68,000 people have been killed in the uprising since and the subsequent Indian military crackdown in Indian administered Kashmir. In the current wave of unrest as of 08/07/16 some 20 protestors have died and more then 200 injured by the crakdown of Indian forces including army and police.

attributes.action: Goverment to make it law all assessments on behalf of the DWP be voice recorded
attributes.background: Due to the amount of assessments being overturned by the tribunal that are carried out on behalf of the DWP,If they are all recorded on a machine that will/can record voice then there can be no mistakes made as to what was said at the  interview and in the long run this will save tax payers money.
attributes.additional_details:
i and many others have had a bad time with company`s that do medical assessments for the DWP many times what has been written in the assessment the claiment says is wrong so if all interviews are voice recorded this would eliminate incorrect  evidance
the claiment should be allowed to supply there own voice recording equipment and record the interview
in my own case i had an interview at home and 4 mths later was booked another one company lied and said no one had been to see me i won my case

attributes.action: Take the lead in bringing internationally mandated prosecutions against SriLanka
attributes.background: We the undersigned urge the British government to take the lead in bringing internationally mandated prosecutions against former and serving officials of the Sri Lankan state for the crimes of genocide, war crimes and crimes against humanity committed against the Tamils.
attributes.additional_details:
In the last stages of the armed conflict in Sri Lanka, 146, 679 Tamils became unaccounted for - either massacred or ‘disappeared’ by the Sri Lankan armed forces.

The UN announced in September 2015 that if established before a court of law, Sri Lanka’s actions may amount to war crimes and/or crimes against humanity. Subsequently, the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights noted that if independent trials were to take place, a court of law may even find Sri Lanka guilty of committing genocide.

attributes.action: End the council tax for every body
attributes.background: We want the government to End the council tax for every body and we can have more money in our pockets council tax is unlawful

attributes.action: Debate the cost of gluten free food and why more isn't done to help families
attributes.background:
My daughter has just been diagnosed with celiac disease and I was so surprised at the amount of money it costs just to buy simple food . And the lack of variety available 
 Also how bad the packaging is labelled informing you of the ingredients

attributes.action: STOP HIV NOW - Reinstate NHS plans to provide life saving PrEP to all at risk
attributes.background:
Following the Budget the NHS unexpectedly scrapped plans to provide HIV preventing PrEP; limiting access to a handful of people and leaving thousands of young & vulnerable people at risk. 

ACT NOW to reverse the decision. Together, we CAN stop the spread of HIV & provide PrEP to ALL those at risk
attributes.additional_details:
WRITE TO YOUR MP - STOP HIV NOW
https://www.writetothem.com/

http://www.pinknews.co.uk/2016/03/21/nhs-abandons-roll-out-of-hiv-preventing-prep-drugs/

http://www.whatisprep.org/
https://www.gmfa.org.uk/prep
http://www.cdc.gov/hiv/basics/prep.html

WHO studies, recommendations and information on verifying PrEPs effectiveness
http://www.who.int/hiv/pub/prep/en/

Additional information and links to HIV organisations, campaigns and support groups:
http://www.dynamicunity.org/general/stop-hiv-now

attributes.action: Amend Official Secrets Act to prohibit its use in cases involving child abuse
attributes.background: Over several decades the Official Secrets Act has been misused to protect paedophiles in positions of power. This is contrary to the public interest and we call on the government to amend the act to ensure that this can not happen again.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement that all Primary School Teachers are First Aid Trained.
attributes.background:
Implement First Aid Training into Teacher Training Courses at universities and schools. 

Make First Aid Training a prerequisite for any person before they become a Qualified Teacher and are left in charge of a class of up to 30 children alone, between the ages of 4 and 11.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no legislation stating a minimum number of First Aid trained staff in a primary school. 

Currently it is up to the Governors and Head Teacher to carry out a risk assessment, based on the outlay of the school, students, staff and other factors, as to how many members of staff they need to be First Aid trained. 

Class Teachers are left alone with up to 30 children in their care, yet there is no legislation stating that they need to have had any previous First Aid Training.

attributes.action: Ban the slaughter of all animals and sale of meat and dairy in the UK
attributes.background: The farming and slaughter of animals is barbaric and cruel. The consumption of meat and dairy is unsustainable for the planet. Large areas of land and forest are being destroyed globally. Animals are sentient beings who deserve the same rights as the humans they share the Earth with.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.livescience.com/27692-deforestation.html

attributes.action: Urgent research for AT/RT Tumours must be done in the UK.
attributes.background: Rhiley Kim Bennett was diagnosed with an AT/RT Tumour on her brain & spine aged just 2 years old on 12th June 2014. We lost our little girl on 23rd April 2015 aged 3. With the majority of under 3's being diagnosed, the chance of survival remains low at just 15% or less.
attributes.additional_details:
* Atypical Teratoid Rhabdoid Tumour known as AT/RT for short. 
* Although usually a brain tumour, it can occur anywhere in the CNS.
* It is the most common solid tumour in childhood cancer. 
* Effects all of the basic bodily functions. 
* AT/RT grows rapidly & patients have a fairly short history of progressive symptoms, measured in days to weeks. 
* It has been challenging to define optimal therapy & advance treatment. 
* The UK currently has no standard protocol itself to follow nor a cure.

attributes.action: Overturn NHS decision to stop children's heart surgery at Glenfield Hospital
attributes.background: My godson's life was saved by the amazing and caring staff at this hospital, as we're many more. We should be helping these places of excellence not closing these departments!

attributes.action: For the court to issue a consecutive sentence and not concurrent.
attributes.background: If a civil servant is assaulted doing their duties and if the person is convicted in court they should get a consecutive sentence to any other convictions and not a concurrent sentence. If that person is serving a life sentence, when granted parole it is then added past their parole date.
attributes.additional_details: Having been assaulted myself where the perpetrator was given a concurrent sentence, where this left me feeling let down by the justice system. More recently a colleague was hit 4 times with a metal pole over his back while dealing with another incident and the perpetrator was given a 4 month concurrent sentence. This is during the zero tolerance to violence which the civil service champions, but when the prisoner is given a concurrent sentence it doesn't send the message of zero tolerance.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of Castle Armoury Bury.
attributes.background: Castle Armoury is a Grade II listed building and is currently occupied by a Platoon of Fusiliers. For over 100 years the building has been in use by Fusiliers in their home town of Bury. We believe that so long as their are Fusiliers in Bury, Castle Armoury should be their home.
attributes.additional_details: Plans have recently been announced that after 100 years of continuous use Castle Armoury is to be sold. The occupying Fusilier Platoon is to be moved to a as yet unannounced location along with the Army and Air Cadets. Since before the start of the First World War the building has been occupied by the Fusiliers and stands as the final link between Fusiliers of the present and those who went away to war never to return. The building is still in use and occupied by serving soldiers.

attributes.action: Art50: Wait for a proposal from the EU on reform, before triggering Article 50.
attributes.background:
Art50 Petition: How to tame the Brexit madness.

People in Britain and Europe are angry with their governments. Frexit or Nexit would tear the financial, economic and political fabric of Europe apart, inflicting further damage on people’s lives.

Stop the Brexit madness! Sign the Art50 Petition!
attributes.additional_details:
UK should request EU proposals on:

- Making EU institutions directly accountable to voters
- Improving cooperation where needed, while protecting national sovereignty 
- Creating a dynamic EU economy, with inclusive growth for all citizens
- Concrete steps to stabilize the Euro, while protecting non-Eurozone

Britain shall request no special treatment as part of the reform. 

A second Brexit referendum can be held after EU reform proposals. Only trigger Article 50 after a second Leave vote.

attributes.action: Hold a public inquiry into the institutional bullying of carers by officialdom.
attributes.background: The institutional bullying of family carers (and those they care for) by various official bodies is now a nationally recognised phenomenon. It is known as 'mother blame' (men are also targeted). A public inquiry into this phenomenon is imperative - to address the issues and halt the practice.
attributes.additional_details:
The institutional bullying of carers (and those they care for) is a regular occurrence within local authorities, the NHS and care companies.

If carers stand up for the person they care for, or make a complaint, they are targeted; facing bullying, harassment and intimidation from those who are supposed to help and support them. Tactics employed against carers include the abuse of the MCA, MHA and safeguarding, deliberately incorrect assessments of capacity/need, general harassment and threats.

attributes.action: Make Washington Tyne & Wear independent from Sunderland City Council
attributes.background: Since Sunderland City Council took over Washington Development Corporation they have used our money to pay for upgrades and improvements to Mowbray Park, Barnes Park, the City Centre and we in Washington are being left out in the cold. Our public services have been cut severely. Take back control
attributes.additional_details: Facebook group Washington in Decline has seen the addition of almost 1,600 member in the last 2 days. Residents from around Washington are uniting in this common cause to stop the rot. Photographs of the litter, the overflowing bins, the fly tipping,  the overgrowing trees and shrubbery and the grass verges along our roads and highways that are causing disruprion and becoming a danger to motorists. We need to stop this NOW. We need an independent voice and independent Council!!

attributes.action: Stop Government using advertising on Gov sites to promote  'Remain in Europe '.
attributes.background: Their action falls under Purdah rules which prohibit Ministers, Departments and local authorities from publishing any promotional material arguing for, or against any particular outcome or any of the issues involved in the Referendum. The Government know the 28 day rule but intend to 'flaunt it' !
attributes.additional_details:
The Government can only issue facts not suppositions or concocted figures to support their views in trying to influence the outcome of the vote. They tried on 9th September 2015 to change the rules specifically for the referendum but were defeated. Certain Gov't members/supporters of the Remain campaign are using any and every method possible to influence the electorate to vote to remain.
This is a serious breach of existing Rules and must result in immediate removal from office.

attributes.action: Ban installation of Sound Limiters in all wedding venues (or increase the limit)
attributes.background: More and more venues are fitting (or are being forced to fit) sound limiters in a bid to appease local council noise restrictions. Whilst this can be good news for local residents living near the venue, it can wreak havoc on a live bands performance.
attributes.additional_details:
Most limiters have a noise restriction of 90-95 Decibels.

At this limit, loud applause can trigger the sound limiter.

When you consider a 5 piece wedding band will normally be in excess of 100 Decibels. A Big Band or Orchestra will be louder still. On top of this, if you consider the loudness of an audience or wedding party, accompanied by alcohol, the sound limiter limit is far too low. 
Please sign this petition to support the removal of Sound Limiters or a increase in sound level allowed

attributes.action: Remove all religious representatives from any Parliamentary institution.
attributes.background: Our Government should be 100% secular and should have no religious bias from any religious group. This means removing The Lords Spiritual from the House of Lords and removing any religious ceremony or act from any part of Parliamentary processes.
attributes.additional_details: The lack of secularism in our society promotes inequality through the definition of people and organisations by their affiliation to religious institutions. To combat inequality, our Political Leaders must be independent of all religious influence, irrespective of the religion, so that all decisions can be made in a fair and balanced way. This independence cannot be accomplished whilst we have members of one religious institution in Parliament in any form.

attributes.action: Formally consult resident EU citizens on whether the UK should leave the EU .
attributes.background: The vast majority of the 3 million EU citizens resident in Britain had no vote in the referendum on Britain’s membership of the EU and if they had been consulted the result could have been different.
attributes.additional_details: EU citizens are those British residents who are most severely affected by the result of the EU referendum but had no say in it. They have a right to vote and stand in local elections and elections to the European Parliament, rights that would be lost if the UK leaves the EU. They are now in a state of uncertainty and fear. This seems a travesty of natural justice. They need to be consulted, for instance by a referendum specific to them.

attributes.action: DVLA to create a driving test specific to the geared scooter at 210cc limit
attributes.background: Scooterists are having to learn on large powered motorcycles in order to access an additional 85cc only. Not only is the training irrelevant, but subjects the rider to risks outside those which he chose to engage to road on a scooter. Training should be relevant to the end purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
Scooter enthusiasts are having to ride motorcycles to pass their test. As a result, many take a CBT biannually, which is increasing in cost exponentially. 2014 £50 with hire 2016 £100-120 with hire

Petition sponsored by Scooter Workshop Community

attributes.action: Change the law to bar convicted sex offenders from local council service.
attributes.background:
We believe that convicted sex offenders should be barred from holding public office as either a Parish Councillor or Local Authority Councillor.
As the law stands, a convicted sex offender cannot be forced to resign. 
We believe this is wrong & once convicted of a crime, sex offenders must resign.
attributes.additional_details:
Last year a parish Councillor was found guilty in Court of downloading more than 400 indecent images from a website.
Despite public pressure, the councillor has refused to resign.
The local MP for the area has been pushing the Government for a change in the law.
It is important that the law is changed so, in future, convicted sex offenders would not have the opportunity to hold public office once they had been convicted.

attributes.action: Recognise the importance of gardening and horticulture
attributes.background: We call on the Government to recognise the importance of gardening and horticulture, not just to the UK economy, but to the health and wellbeing of people, and ask for policies to recognise its importance across all relevant Government departments.
attributes.additional_details: There is a growing body of evidence to suggest that gardening has health and wellbeing benefits, both in terms of physical activity to being beneficial to suffers of mental health issues. These benefits cut across all age ranges, from young people learning about healthy eating and where our food comes from through "growing their own" to older generations benefiting from regular physical activity which has beneficial implication in terms of mental and physical wellbeing.

attributes.action: Make not paying a taxi/private hire soiling fee a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
Why is the soiling fee not a criminal offence when not paying the fare on the meter is a criminal offence.

So many times drivers are put off the road while they get there car cleaned and back up to standard, why should the driver be out of pocket when it was no fault of the driver.

attributes.action: Everyone on National Minimum Wage should receive the same wage regardless of age
attributes.background: I'm starting this petition simply because I and many others believe it is unfair that the Minimum Wage Rate rises in age groups. Why do under 18's get paid £3.90 less for working the same hours and carrying out the same job role as a 25+ year old?
attributes.additional_details: For example, I myself have been on minimum wage (under 18 wage rate) for just under a year. So if I decided to stay in this job role towards the future, I would have to wait 9 YEARS to receive FULL MINIMUM wage. What will I have done in 9 years of waiting for this wage? Yes, I may have more work experience. Yes, I may be more advanced and have more knowledge in this career. But I will still be working 42 hours a week doing the exact same job daily what I was doing at the age of 18, 9 years ago.

attributes.action: Highways England to set 50mph speed limit on A34 between Chieveley & West Ilsley
attributes.background: The A34 between Chieveley and West Ilsley currently has a national speed limit (70mph) and carries significant volumes of traffic past slip-roads with very poor intervisibility between vehicles joining and proceeding along the A34 at East Ilsley and Beedon. This results in frequent accidents.

attributes.action: Stop further public funds being used to set out the case for remaining in the EU
attributes.background: The recent distribution of literature at a cost of over £9 Million, making the case for the UK to remain in the EU, undermines the Electoral Commissions objectives of the Referendum and demonstrates a lack of integrity by the Government. We believe voters deserve a fair referendum
attributes.additional_details: The Electoral commission has put a spending limit of £7 million for each of the designated Lead campaign groups (Remain or Leave) in the EU referendum. This has been designed to make the case fair for both sides. By Spending £9.2 million the Government have clearly shown bias using Tax Payers funds. We, the petitioners, request the Government to prevent future tax payer funds, from any source, UK or EU, being used to make the case for the UK remaining in the EU.

attributes.action: Restrict all dog breeding establishments to a maximum of 5 litters per year
attributes.background: The Panorama programme on BBC1 highlighted the horror of puppy farming. These people own hundreds of dogs and make vast sums of money from breeding puppies, many of whom are sick or have inherited conditions. Restricting all breeding establishments to 5 litters a year will eradicate puppy farms.
attributes.additional_details: There is a wealth of evidence on puppy farming and that local authorities are routinely granting licences to establishments that are churning out puppies that are sick, have inherited conditions and behaviours issues due to the limited human contact and the conditions they are raised in.

attributes.action: Shut down the domestic ivory market in the UK.
attributes.background: The Conservatives pledged to shut down the UK’s domestic ivory market in their manifesto for the past two elections. 30,000 African Elephants are slaughtered a year for their tusks yet, the government has still not outlawed the trade. From 2009 to 2014, 40% of UK customs seizures were ivory items.
attributes.additional_details: Many African nations, the US, France and even China have committed to outlawing the markets. There are only around 450,000 African Elephants left, in another six years there will be almost half this amount if governments continue to turn a blind eye; the UK are putting Elephants at risk from extinction. If there were not a market, then the elephants would no longer be in danger. The UK needs to set an example that the only tusks of value are those on a live Elephant, before they cease to exist.

attributes.action: Charge non-resident parents who evade child support payments with child neglect.
attributes.background:
Current legislation does not recognise non-payment of child support as neglect. After a year of non-compliance separate criminal charges should be brought against such non-resident parents for child neglect.

Resident parents should also be able to prosecute non-compliant NRP for financial abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
Figures from 2011 indicate that 95.2% of parents who approached the Child Support Agency in order to access their legal entitlement for child maintenance were female. The failure to collect rates are astonishing. It is therefore a gender inequality issue.
This  social injustice needs to be urgently addressed.The far reaching repercussions have to be legally recognised for both the parent with care and the child/ren when one parent fails to support their child/ren.
It is neglect and abuse.

attributes.action: MPs under investigation should not be allowed to sit in the House of Commons
attributes.background: MPs under investigation for election fraud should not be allowed to sit in the House of Commons. How is it possible for us to live in a democracy when our own MPs are not held accountable for their actions, and even if they are the police answers to the house so it's therefore a conflict of interest

attributes.action: Stop the proposed freight hub at Gailey destroying our greenbelt land!
attributes.background: Government plans to build a railway freight hub on our greenbelt land are devastating our local community. We are fed up of being lied to. This is our wildlife and our peace and quiet - please get involved by signing our petition and stopping there being a 'one rule for one' culture with greenbelt!

attributes.action: Transfer long term DLA claims to PiP automatically
attributes.background: People that have been claiming DLA for extended periods of time should be transferred automatically to PiP at the same or increased rate that they where receiving under the old system. They could then be re assessed on a paper assessment at a later date. This would free up the system lightening the
attributes.additional_details:
load on the DWP and negating the need to involve ATOS which is widely recognized as being not fit for purpose.
Re-diagnosing someone using under qualified inexperienced personal is a waste of tax payers money. The high volume of appeals won is testament to this fact. A clinical diagnosis is far more qualified than a practice nurse being paid by numbers. This gov. is wasting far more money trying to weed out the minority that would abuse the system than it saves by finding them.

attributes.action: Stop the NHS closure of the Royal Brompton hospital heart unit.
attributes.background: The Royal Brompton hospital has helped thousands of both adults and children who are born with heart problems. The unit continues to meet all NHS standards and is a leading heart unit. They helped to save my life as a child and they still look after me. They off great support and treatment

attributes.action: Change the Gambling Act to prevent bookmakers conning people.
attributes.background: Most Bookmakers with a UK licence routinely and on mass, ban some customers from taking part in their publicly advertised promotions. This is false advertising and conning people to gamble, then refusing without reason to honour the advertised offer and excluding them from all future offers.
attributes.additional_details: Ban Bookmakers using the term "We reserve the right to restrict or exclude people from our offers at our discretion and without notice or warning" This quite simply should not be allowed it is totally unfair and discriminating. A supermarket cannot exclude customers from its publicly advertised promotion offers, so why is a bookmaker allowed to? In other Countries, where a bookmaker makes an offer public of say "bet £25 and get £25 free" they have to honour that to everyone who takes part in it.

attributes.action: Stop the deportation of Syrian asylum seekers
attributes.background: Faisal, 18 years old, and his father Ahmad are Syrians who arrived in the UK to seek asylum in June 2015. They are both facing deportation to Hungary where they were forced to claim asylum under duress. A considerable proportion of those returned to Hungary were detained in asylum detention centres.
attributes.additional_details: The Council of Europe Commissioner for Human Rights, Nils Muižnieks, has stated that 'asylum seekers returned to Hungary run a considerable risk of being subject to human rights violations.' Also, as there are systemic flaws in the asylum procedure and in the reception conditions in Hungary, the UK is not permitted under international law to deport asylum seekers to that country. The only other option for Ahmad and his son is to return to Syria and face the risk of being killed in the conflict.

attributes.action: Do not amend the Hunting Act using a Statutory Instrument
attributes.background:
Mr Cameron is likely to repeal the fox hunting ban through the back door using a Statutory Instrument which does not require a vote in parliament. Over 80% of the British people and most MPs don't wish to see fox hunting reintroduced.

Please sign to show your disgust in this undemocratic act.
attributes.additional_details:
Mr Cameron has said he believes in the "freedom to hunt" and wants fox hunting legalised. He will go to any lengths to achieve this including riding over the will of parliament and that of the British people.

Fox hunting involves chasing and killing a fox, on horseback, with a pack of dogs, in traditional dress. This is a vicious and outdated pastime, and the idea of repealing the ban introduced by the Labour government, so that people like Cameron can hunt and kill foxes is a horrific one.

attributes.action: A & E, Maternity, Stroke services be maintained at the NDDH.
attributes.background:
The NHS have set up a "Success Regime" project for North & East Devon and this has given rise to fears that "red line" services such as
Accident & Emergency, Maternity and Stroke services will be withdrawn from the North Devon District Hospital.

attributes.action: Stop the closure of the Mental Health Welland Centre in Market Harborough.
attributes.background: This centre is my sole source of free support where I, like so many others, have crucial appointments with a psychiatrist. The closure of this centre means appointments would be held in Wigton. But for people who cannot drive and have anxiety when using public transport this will made be difficult.
attributes.additional_details: The wider issue here is the governments neglect of the mental health services in the United Kingdom. I realise there are probably many cases in towns, villages or cities where these centres are being closed down and I would encourage those effected by these changed to petition against them too.

attributes.action: keep F1 (Formula 1) on free to air television
attributes.background: From 2019, Formula 1 will no longer be shown on free to air television in the UK. All rights have been purchased by Sky which means the only way to view will be by paying a monthly subscription. The British GP is the only race that will be shown for free. Please sign if you think this is unfair.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for CCTV to be installed in all slaughterhouses
attributes.background: I am disgusted by the increase in animal abuse reported in the United Kingdom in slaughter houses. From malpractice to sheet cruelty we need to find a way to ensure that these awful people can be punished. this would be a fantastic step forward in step changing animal welfare in this country.

attributes.action: Remove the Under 10m Inshore fishing vessels from the quota system.
attributes.background:
The quota system has been a nightmare for the fishing industry and fish stocks in general. The disgusting practice of throwing back good quality fish that are dead or have no chance of survival must be stopped.
Quota systems simply do not work in mixed fisheries.
attributes.additional_details:
In other countries such as Norway (that are not in the EU and bound by unmanageable rules and regulations) small inshore vessels are excluded from quota's and they have a thriving industry and healthy fish stocks.
Everybody understands the need for conservation and the quota system needs replacing with a more sustainable and environmentally friendly method such as limited days at sea and/or fishing gear restrictions. 
Throwing back dead fish is immoral and wrong and must be stopped.

attributes.action: Make 'may contain' warnings mandatory on food labels.
attributes.background: You're a parent to a child with a severe allergy. You spend time in the shop studying food labels. You give your child something you think is safe. Suddenly their lips, tongue and throat swell. They fight for breath. Lose consciousness. Where's the EpiPen? In their school bag? Quick! QUICK!
attributes.additional_details:
Food producers must show common allergens in the ingredients lists of their products, but if a product 'may contain' allergens due to cross contamination it is the manufacturer who decides whether to detail that on the label.  

For some this could be life threatening, for others it could cause weeks of discomfort. 

We ask that the Food Standards Agency ensure that consumers are made aware when there is genuine potential for traces of common allergens to be present in packaged food.

attributes.action: Ban plastic "6 pack rings" and use biodegradable / edible alternatives
attributes.background: Over 100,000 marine animals and 1m sea birds die each year after digesting or getting stuck in plastic "6 pack rings".  I would like government to force manufacturers to use environmentally friendly alternatives / edible (for aquatic life) options.
attributes.additional_details: "6 Pack Ring" refers to the plastic rings used to keep 6 tins or cans of drink together.  As an Island nation we should take the lead to protect our shores and the animals that inhabit them.  A company in the US has developed an edible (to the aquatic life) alternative made using grains from the brewing process.  The rings we use now are photodegradable but can take up to 90 days to break.  Plenty of time to kill a seal, bird, turtle or other marine life that thinks it's something to eat.

attributes.action: Stop the removal of NHS bursaries for student radiographers and nurses
attributes.background: An NHS bursary is currently available for students studying Radiography and Nursing. This is essential financial support as these courses involve both clinical and academic components. The Government is proposing to remove these bursaries and replace them with student loans.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS bursary supports the student to undertake clinical placements as part of their training. These can be up to 16 weeks in duration and in rural areas the distance between the campus and hospital is uncommutable, requiring the student to pay rent on their main accommodation plus rent, living and travel expenses in their clinical setting. This is financially disadvantageous to students in rural areas like Cumbria, Devon and Northumberland and will have a negative impact on the profession.
